item.title: Sonic Powered announces survival roguelike game WARHEAD CIRCUS for PC, now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Survive a non-stop barrage of missiles.

Sonic Powered has announced survival roguelike game WARHEAD CIRCUS for PC. It is available now via Steam at a 15 percent-off launch discount price of $6.79. The price will change to $8.99 after December 29.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

Survive a non-stop barrage of missiles in this science-fiction survival against death!

WARHEAD CIRCUS is a survival roguelike where you use afterburners and barrel rolls to evade missiles on unpredictable trajectories.

Master the controls of your fighter and survive with 100% synch rate using your player skills!!

Power Up by Attacks!

Your machine guns will automatically fire when you are near the enemy.

Attack enemies to gain experience points that you can use to upgrade your jet fighter!

You’re all alone! No one’s coming!

How long can you survive?

item.title: Hollow Knight coming to Switch 2 in 2026 alongside updates for current platforms
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One

New features new available in public-beta branch on PC.

Team Cherry has announced Hollow Knight – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. It will launch in 2026 as a free upgrade for users who already own the Switch version of Hollow Knight.

The Nintendo Switch 2 Edition will incorporate “all the updates and enhancements” Hollow Knight: Silksong received on Switch 2, including high frame rate modes, higher resolutions, and additional graphical effects.

In preparation for the Switch 2 release, Team Cherry plans to update “all versions of the original [Hollow Knight] for current platforms, adding features and fixing bugs.” PC users can experience “many” of those updates now via public-beta branches on Steam and GOG. New features now available in the public-beta branch include:

  • Added support for 21:9 and 16:10 resolutions.
  • Game now pauses while in inventory menus.
  • Upgraded to Unity Input System for broader controller support (original input system is still available, if preferred, via Options>Controller>Advanced Settings).
  • Added dithering effect, and dithering options, to reduce color banding.
  • Fixed a softlock in City of Tears Grub room.
  • Reduced Grey Prince Zote’s stagger bounce height.
  • Updated Sly’s Great Slash collider to closer match visual.
  • Salubra’s Blessing now deactivates after reaching max Soul.
  • Map panning is now smoother
  • Various smaller fixes and tweaks.

Hollow Knight is available now for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and GOG.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong free expansion ‘Sea of Sorrow’ announced
item.content:encoded:
Team Cherry has announced free Hollow Knight: Silksong expansion “Sea of Sorrow.” It will launch in 2026. The game has also surpassed seven million sales.

“New areas, bosses, tools, and more!” Team Cherry teased. “Hornet’s adventures continue in our nautically themed expansion, coming free for all players next year. We’ll keep further details a secret for now, but expect additional info shortly before Hollow Knight: Silksong ‘Sea of Sorrow’ releases.”

Hollow Knight: Silksong is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam, GOG, Humble Store, and Microsoft Store. It is also available via Game Pass.
